newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian lending rate up 40 bps to 11.8.
newsitem.headline: Croatian lending rate up 40 bps to 11.8.

text.p: The Croatian average lending rate rose 40 basis points to 11.8 percent on Friday amid stronger demand for fresh kuna funds, dealers said.
They put total daily settlements at 28.9 million kuna. Borrowers asked for another 22.1 million kuna but could not agree on terms with lenders.
Fresh loans accounted for 19 million kuna, three quarters of which were granted at a steady call money rate of 10.5 percent. One-month placements were struck at 14 and 16 percent.
Insurers rolled over previous 3.8 million kuna at nine and 15 percent. Banks extended old loans at rates varying from 12-16 percent.
The central bank calculated its kuna midrates slightly firmer at 6.1228 against the dollar and at 3.5737 against the German mark. -- Zoran Radosavljevic, Zagre Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
